pageContext.claim: “Saudi Arabia has now agreed to spend the necessary money needed to help rebuild Syria, instead of the United States. See? Isn't it nice when immensely wealthy countries help rebuild their neighbors rather than a Great Country, the U.S., that is 5000 miles away. Thanks to Saudi A!”
pageContext.analysis: The Saudis had promised this money months ago but only delivered some of it when it came under fire for ordering the murder of Washington Post contributor Jamal Khashoggi. The Saudi government said after Trump's tweet that it had made no new commitment. The United States spends comparably less per capita on foreign aid than many other industrialized countries, and there is goodwill generated through foreign aid.
